EmailTemplate.subject: The Power of Customer Feedback
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<http://aerospace.honeywell.com/services> <https://twitter.com/Honeywell_Aero> <http://www.youtube.com/honeywell> <https://plus.google.com/109803702550636260475> <http://www.linkedin.com/company/honeywell-aerospace>
Here’s how.
It’s the simplest, most powerful rule of business – if you’re selling to a customer, you give ‘em what they want. In the last Honeywell Customer Experience Team email, we shared the top-three things customers expect from our company. Now, let’s take an in-depth view of what they’re looking for. Customer Support: OEM surveys said they wanted immediate attention from someone qualified to answer their question when they called. So Honeywell completely rebuilt our technical service call center to eliminate hand-offs and immediately connect customers with Honeywell experts. We increased the average tenure of the tech staff from 8-20 years, and provide true 24X7 service. Delivery: To help guide customers through the time and cost intensive period after taking possession of a new platform, Honeywell created the Entry Into Service (EIS) Team. A unique offering in the industry, EIS supports new platform owners with training, operational guidance, and trouble shooting. Communication: Finding information on Service Bulletins is a painstaking experience, customers told us. So we’re changing that. Instead of sifting through every SB or RMU currently available for every platform, AT&Rs Performance Accelerator <http://performanceaccel.honeywell.com> automatically searches for and displays information that pertains to the client’s fleet.
These are just some of the things we’re doing as a company to meet the expectations of our best customers. In our next emailing, the Honeywell Customer Experience team will offer a few suggestions on working with customers who may not be in the best of moods. Let us know your needs. The Honeywell Customer Experience Team is on your team.
